intro: Andryala cheiranthifolia subvar. integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. Its flowers are typically pink to purple, with four petals and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments.
